text: The Huaral Province is one of the nine provinces in the Lima Region of Peru. It was created by Law No. 21488 on May 11, 1976 by president Francisco Morales Bermúdez out of eight districts of the Canta Province and four of the Huaura Province. Municipalidad Provincial de Huaral, Huaral provincia. Retrieved on November 3, 2007. Geographically, its territory extends around the valley of the Chancay River from the mountainous frontier of the Pasco Region and Junín Region up to the Pacific Ocean. Municipalidad Provincial de Huaral, Ubicación geográfica. Retrieved on November 3, 2007. == Geography == The Puwaq Hanka mountain range traverses the province. Some of the highest peaks of the province are listed below:escale.minedu.gob.pe - UGEL map of the Huaral Province (Lima Region) ==Political division== The province is divided into twelve districts (Spanish: distritos, singular: distrito): * Huaral * Atavillos Alto * Atavillos Bajo * Aucallama * Chancay * Ihuari * 27 de Noviembre * Lampian * Pacaraos *Santa Cruz de Andamarca * Sumbilca * San Miguel de Acos ==Attractions== * Lomas de Lachay - national reserve. * Huando oranges were Huaral's most important products in the 20th century. * Thermal baths of Collpa. == See also == * Challwaqucha * Willkaqucha * Yanawayin Lake ==External links== * Official website * Fotos de Huaral * La Plaza Centenario en GoogleEarth * La Plaza de Armas en GoogleEarth * Huaral en linea * Huaral en la Web ==Notes== Category:Provinces of the Lima Region
title: Huaral Province
